rule-5-1-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with two above-grade wall surfaces at different azimuth angles. Each wall has a window and the windows differ in area by more than 5%. Four sets of baseline model results are appropriately provided.

standard.rule_description: There are four baseline rotations (i.e., four baseline models differing in azimuth by 90 degrees and four sets of baseline model results) if vertical fenestration area per each orientation differ by more than 5%.

rule-5-1-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with two above-grade wall surfaces at different azimuth angles. Each wall has a window and the windows differ in area by less than 5%. One set of baseline model results is appropriately provided.

standard.rule_description: There are four baseline rotations (i.e., four baseline models differing in azimuth by 90 degrees and four sets of baseline model results) if vertical fenestration area per each orientation differ by more than 5%.

rule-5-1-c.test_description: Project has one building segment with two above-grade wall surfaces at different azimuth angles. Each wall has a window and the windows differ in area by more than 5%. One set of baseline model results is provided, when four sets are expected.

standard.rule_description: There are four baseline rotations (i.e., four baseline models differing in azimuth by 90 degrees and four sets of baseline model results) if vertical fenestration area per each orientation differ by more than 5%.
